content:
• Friday, December 28, 2018
  • CASH

    RIG, MDR, WTW and TRXC among notable after hour movers

    • Gainers: CASH +9.7%. WTW +5.3%.SEND +4.7%. VC +3.4%. EQT +3.3%.
    • Losers: TRXC -11.8%. MDR -5.2%. ADAP -4.9%. GDI -4.7%. RIG -4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 20 Comments

  • Stocks end the week up, after a volatile session

    • Stocks end mixed on Friday, wrapping up a volatile week.
    • S&P slipped 0.1%, Nasdaq +0.1%, and Dow -0.3%.
    • For the week, stock market indices rose for the first time in a month. The S&P increased 2.9% for the week, the Nasdaq +4.0%, Dow +2.8%.
    • Healthcare was the best-performing sector of the week, up 1.3%, followed by services, up 1.2%.
    • The week's laggards were utilities (-2.1%) and consumer goods (-0.4%).
    • In Friday's action, Amazon (+1.1%) and AT&T (+1.1%) both ended on an upnote, as did financials Berkshire Hathaway (+1.0%) and Wells Fargo (+0.6%).
    • On the downside, Exxon Mobil sank 1.1%, Facebook (-1.0%), Mastercard (-1.3%), UPS (-1.3%), and Noble Energy (-2.5%).
    • Crude oil +1.1% to $45.09/bbl.
    • Gold +0.1% to $1,282.70/oz.
    • 10-year Treasury yield shrinks 5 basis points to 2.72%.
    • U.S. dollar index falls 0.2% to 96.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • AWSM

    WIN, MAXR, & QTM among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Cool Holdings (NASDAQ:AWSM) +64%. Quantum Corporation (NYSE:QTM-OLD) +27%. Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) +16%. Maxar Technologies (NYSE:MAXR) +16%. Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) +15%.
    • Losers: CLPS Incorporation (NASDAQ:CLPS) -31%. Uxin Limited (NASDAQ:UXIN) -27%. Professional Diversity Network (NASDAQ:IPDN) -15%. The9 Limited (NASDAQ:NCTY) -13%. VirTra (NASDAQ:VTSI) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore Services and Emerge Energy Services among Energy/Materials gainers; Camber Energy and Range Resources among losers

    • Gainers: Hornbeck Offshore Services (NYSE:HOS) +32%. Emerge Energy Services (NYSE:EMES) +19%. ION Geophysical (NYSE:IO) +16%. Golden Star Resources (NYSEMKT:GSS) +14%. TETRA Technologies (NYSE:TTI) +13%.
    • Losers: Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -16%. Range Resources (NYSE:RRC) -5%. Antero Resources (NYSE:AR) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears closing another 80 stores by March

    • Sears (OTCPK:SHLDQ +8.7%) plans to close another 80 stores in March as it faces liquidation.
    • The company told employees it would begin liquidation sales at the locations in two weeks.
    • Since its bankruptcy filing, Sears has closed 260 of its roughly 700 stores.
    • Check here for the full list of closing locations.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 61 Comments
  • DHI

    Homebuilders stocks ready to ring out the year

    • With less than two trading days left to the year, here's how homebuilders' stocks stack up.
    • Starting with the broader view: iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF (ITB -0.4%) slid 31% over the course of the year compared with a 5.3% decline for the SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY +0.2%).
    • As for specific names:
    1. D.R. Horton (DHI -0.3%) lost 32% since the end of last year.
    2. KB Home (KBH -1%) -39%
    3. PulteGroup (PHM -0.3%) -22%
    4. Toll Brothers (TOL +0.2%) -32%
    5. Lennar (LEN -0.6%) -38%
    6. NVR (NVR -0.3%) -30%
    • Taking a longer-term view, ITB surged 58% in the same period in 2017 vs. SPY's paltry 20% increase.
    • In 2016, the ITB was basically flat, and in 2015, it gained 5.8%.
    • Previously: Housing weakness deepens - pending home sales down 0.7% (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 4 Comments

    Kingsway Financial Services leads financials gainers; Select Income REIT and Blue Capital Reinsurance losers

    • Gainers: Kingsway Financial Services (NYSE:KFS) +18%. CPI Card Group (NASDAQ:PMTS) +14%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) +9%. Peoples Bancorp of North Carolina (NASDAQ:PEBK) +8%. Kingstone Companies (NASDAQ:KINS) +8%.

Quantum Corporation (NYSE:QTM-OLD) +28%. Mersana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MRSN) +28%. Kewaunee Scientific Corporation (NASDAQ:KEQU) +27%. Hornbeck Offshore Services (NYSE:HOS) +24%. Unum Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UMRX) +19%.

Scholar Rock Holding Corporation (NASDAQ:SRRK) -13%. BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) -12%. Ideanomics (NASDAQ:IDEX) -12%. ShiftPixy (NASDAQ:PIXY) -11%. Replimune Group (NASDAQ:REPL) -11%. Marin Software Incorporated (NASDAQ:MRIN) -10%.

  • MNKD

    CVI discloses MannKind passive stake

    • CVI Investments discloses a 6.3% passive stake in MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD).
    • MannKind shares are up 7.8% to $1.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 11 Comments
  • KEQU

    JAKKS Pacific and Ballantyne Strong among consumer gainers; Energous leads losers

    • Gainers: Kewaunee Scientific (NASDAQ:KEQU) +25%. Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) +16%. JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) +12%. Ballantyne Strong (NYSEMKT:BTN) +12%. Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) +9%.
    • Losers: Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) -15%. Farmmi (NASDAQ:FAMI) -5%.

  • IPAR

    Inter Parfums -3% as BWS steps to sidelines

    • Independent research firm BWS Financial downgrades Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR) from Buy to Hold and drops the target from $75 to $65.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Inter Parfums shares are up 3% in the quarter and 53% YTD. The company has 3 Buy-equivalent analyst ratings and 3 holds with an average price target of $67.80.
    • IPAR is down 1.7% to $65.06.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM

  • Stocks wobble in midday trading

    • U.S. stocks manage gains in midday trading as conglomerates (+1.2%) and financials (+0.4%) take over as the strongest-performing sectors.
    • S&P 500 rises 0.2%, Nasdaq (+0.2%) and Dow (+0.3%), after spending much of the morning in the red.
    • Lagging sectors are utilities (-0.1%) and consumer goods (-0.1%), which had been one of the strongest performers earlier in the morning.
    • Individual names on the upswing include: Amazon (+1.2%), Abbvie (+1.4%), Berkshire Hathaway (+1.1%), Wells Fargo (+1.0%), Intel (+1.1%), and AT&T (+1.3%).
    • Crude oil gains 1.9% to $45.47/bbl, and gold basically flat at $1,281.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 23 Comments
  • BAC

    Financials' decline abates, for the time being

    • After a brutal year, financial stocks are getting a little relief--very little.
    • The Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF is up 0.1% in midday trading. At least, it's up.
    • For 2018 to date, the ETF has slid 14% compared with the SPDR S&P 500 ETF, which is down 5% over the same period.
    • Among U.S. megabanks, Bank of America (BAC +0.9%), Citigroup (C +0.9%), JPMorgan Chase (JPM +0.8%), and Wells Fargo (WFC +1.1%) are up.
    • Most regional U.S. banks are also in the green, with New York Community Bancorp (NYCB +1.9%) leading. Others notching up gains: Regions Financial (RF +0.7%), CIT Group (CIT +0.8%), M&T Bancorp (MTB +0.6%), and Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB +0.6%).
    • The biggest financial gainers at midday are multinational banks that are based outside of the U.S.--Deutsche Bank (DB +3.3%), UBS Group (UBS +2.7%), ICICI Bank (IBN +1.6%), Barclays (BCS +1.7%), and Lloyds Banking Group (LYG +1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 40 Comments
  • AMAT

    Another strong day for semi equipment

    • Semi equipment stocks are boosting the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index +0.5% higher for the second day after spending the year among the worst performing sector stocks.
    • Gainers: (AMAT +2%), (ENTG +2.8%), (ASML +1.3%), (MKSI +0.9%), (LRCX +1.6%), (ACLS +1.6%), (TER +0.9%), (UCTT +0.9%), (BRKS +0.4%), (AXTI +2.2%).
    • Related semi ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 15 Comments
  • VTVT

    OPKO Health and Prana Biotechnology among healthcare gainers; Novus Therapeutics among losers

    • Gainers: vTv Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTVT) +153%. PLx Pharma (NASDAQ:PLXP) +27%. OPKO Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) +26%. Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) +19%. Mesoblast (NASDAQ:MESO) +15%.
    • Losers: BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) -16%. Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) -11%. Replimune Group (NASDAQ:REPL) -9%. Novus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NVUS) -7%. Scholar Rock Holding (NASDAQ:SRRK) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 2 Comments

  • Crude stocks flat last week

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories: Crude -0.0M barrels vs. -2.9M consensus, -0.5M last week.
    • Gasoline +3.0M barrels vs. +0.0M consensus, +1.8M last week.
    • Distillates +0.0M barrels vs. -0.5M consensus, -4.2M last week.
    • Futures -0.04% to $44.59.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, USL, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 65 Comments
  • NEWT

    Newtek +3% on Buy upgrade

    • Financial services firm Ladenburg Thalmann upgrades Newtek (NASDAQ:NEWT) from Neutral to Buy with a $19 price target.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
    • Newtek has 2 Buy-equivalent analyst ratings and 4 Holds with an average price target of $20.25.
    • Newtek shares are down nearly 19% in the quarter and 6% YTD.
    • NEWT is up 2.9% to $17.87.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 6 Comments

  • Natural gas inventory draw slightly less than consensus

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -48 Bcf vs. -52 Bcf consensus, -141 Bcf last week.
    • Futures -5.27% to $3.359.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL en
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 26 Comments
  • GLPH

    Gala Pharmaceutical +17% after California grants temporary license

    • Nano cap Gala Pharmaceutical (OTCPK:GLPH) surges 17% after the the company gets a temporary license from the state of California for its cannabis testing facility in Long Beach, CA.
    • Gala expects to start building the facility as soon as it gets final building permits from the city of Long Beach.
    • Previously: Gala Pharma files for cannabis testing lab in California (Dec. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell returns public at $46; JPMorgan initiates

    • JPMorgan welcomes Dell (DELL-OLD)(DVMT) back to public trading with an initiation at Overweight with a $60 price target.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
    • Dell shares debuted with a $46 opening today.
    • The tracking stock buyout, which let Dell return public without an IPO, cost the company $23.9B. The company returned to trading to cope with its $52.7B debt pile.
    • Previously: VMware pays $11B dividend, Dell goes public (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 15 Comments

  • Natural gas slides further on warm weather forecast

    • The latest outlook calls for above-average temps for the lower 48 in the 2nd week of January, according to Bloomberg.
    • The most recent inventory numbers are coming up, but stocks are already at their lowest seasonal level in more than a decade.
    • Natural gas is down 4.85% prior to the numbers, to $3.374. UNG -3.6%
    • ETFs: UNG, UGAZ, DGAZ, BOIL, KOLD, UNL, DCNG, GAZB
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 4 Comments
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum surges 30% after obtaining $210M long-term financing

    • Quantum (NYSE:QTM-OLD) soars 30% in early trading after refinancing its current debt facilities.
    • New $210M of total credit facilities consists of $165M senior secured term loan facility and a $45M revolving credit facility.
    • The new loan will be used to repay outstanding debt and related fees and interest, totaling $124.6M for its current term loan and $21.2M for its current revolving credit facility.
    • Cash and cash equivalents at Dec. 28 are about $14M; amount drawn down under new revolving credit facility is $4.4M.
    • Additionally, Quantum says NYSE could grant a final extension on continued listing and trading to Feb. 15, 2019 if Quantum doesn't become current with its SEC periodic filings by Jan. 15, 2019.
    • Company warns that its shares may be subject to delisting on or about Jan. 15, 2019, if an extension isn't granted.
    • Previously: Quantum +21.4% as accounting probe mostly wraps (Sept. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • SNE

    Sony ramps 3D sensors on smartphone demand

    • Sony (SNE -0.3%) is boosting production of its next-gen sensor for 3D cameras by an unspecified amount after interest from customers including Apple.
    • Sony will kick off mass production late next summer to meet demand for the sensors, which power the 3D cameras found in smartphones.
    • SNE holds about half of the camera chip market with other clients including Alphabet and Samsung.
    • Rivals: Lumentum (LITE +2%), STMicroelectronics (STM +1.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 10 Comments
  • TSLA

    Wedbush sees Tesla board additions as `major step forward'

    • Tesla's (TSLA +1.2%) move to add Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison to its board is "another major step forward" as the electric-carmaker seeks to build an independent board to guide its growth, according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives.
    • Ellison could help channel Elon Musk's energy into positives for the company and away from the "going private" narrative that hangs over the stock, Ives writes in a note.
    • Walgreens Boots Alliance's Kathleen Wilson-Thompson is a "second impressive" independent board member, he adds.
    • Keeps outperform rating and $440 price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 14 buys; 9 holds; 11 underperform/sells.
    • Previously: Tesla +3.7% after proposing adding Ellison, Wilson-Thompson to board (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 105 Comments
  • QTM-OLD

    SBGL, GOV among premarket gainers

    • Quantum (NYSE:QTM-OLD) +42% on refinance of its current debt facilities.
    • Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) +36% on repaying line of credit and converting into equity.
    • OPKO Health (NYSEMKT:OPK) +16% as CEO agree to settle SEC probe.
    • Aphria (NYSE:APHA) +12% as Green Growth's proposal undervalues its share.
    • Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) +10%.
    • Government Properties Income Trust (NYSE:GOV-OLD) +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

    SIR among premarket losers

    • Select Income REIT (NYSE:SIR) -51% on completing distribution of 45M common shares of Industrial Logistics Properties Trust.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • HTGM

    HTG Molecular -4% on stock offer filing

    • HTG Molecular Diagnostics (NASDAQ:HTGM) files to offer up to $150M in common stock.
    • HTGM is down 4.3% premarket to $2.21.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Tesla +3.7% after proposing adding Ellison, Wilson-Thompson to board

    • Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) jumps 3.7% in premarket trading after proposing to add Oracle Chairman Larry Ellison and Walgreens Boots Alliance executive Kathleen Wilson-Thompson to its board in compliance with an SEC settlement, CNBC reports.
    • Wilson-Thompson is WBA's global head of human resources.
    • In September, Tesla and CEO Elon Musk agreed to appoint a new chairman and two independent board members to settle SEC charges that Musk misled investors when he tweeted about a plan to take the company private at $420 per share.
    • Previously: Tesla registers leasing company in China (Dec. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 228 Comments
  • MESO

    Mesoblast announces corporate review; shares up 8% premarket

    • Mesoblast (NASDAQ:MESO) announces corporate review. Cardiovascular partner Tasly Pharmaceuticals will meet with National Medical Products Administration to discuss the regulatory approval pathway in China in Q1 2019.
    • In Q1 2019, the Company plans to initiate the FDA process of filing a Biologics License Application (BLA) for market authorization of remestemcel-L in the U.S., where there are no approved therapies for steroid-refractory acute Graft Versus Host Disease (aGVHD).
    • In H1 2019, Mesoblast plans to meet with the FDA to discuss a potential approval pathway following the clinically meaningful outcomes of reduction in major gastrointestinal bleeding (GI) and related hospitalizations seen in the U.S. National Institutes of Health - sponsored Phase 2 trial of MPC-150-IM (Revascor) in patients with end-stage heart failure and a left ventricular assist device.
    • The Company plans to complete recruitment in Phase 3 events-driven trial in Advanced Heart Failure in Q1 2019.
    • The Company also plans to establish global partnership for MPC-06-ID for chronic low back pain.
    • Shares are up 8% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware pays $11B dividend, Dell goes public

    • Today's the day for VMware's (NYSE:VMW) previously announced $11B one-time special dividend related to the Dell (DVMT) tracking stock buyout.
    • The dividend amount is $26.81 per outstanding share of VMW common stock.
    • Dell Class C shares are expected to start trading on the NYSE today under the DELL ticker.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 16 Comments
  • ADBE

    DZ Bank says Buy to Adobe

    • German bank DZ Bank upgrades Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) from Hold to Buy with a $260 price target, a 15% upside. The upgrade follows a 16% pullback in the quarter for ADBE. Shares are up 28% YTD.
    • Source: Briefing.com.
    • Adobe has 21 Buy-equivalent analyst ratings and 10 Holds with an average price target of $291.52.
    • ADBE shares are up 1.9% premarket to $229.44.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • CRH

    CRH +2.4% after starting fourth phase of buyback program

    • CRH (NYSE:CRH) gains 2.4% in premarket trading after entering arrangements to repurchase up to €200M of shares in the fourth phase of its share repurchase program.
    • Completes phase 3 of its share buyback program, buying back €100M of shares.
    • Plans to buy back up to €1B of ordinary shares over the next year.
    • Previously: CRH update to Phase 3 of buyback program (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
  • WING

    Wedbush steps off Wingstop sidelines

    • Following a 6% pullback this quarter and November's announced DoorDash partnership, sell-side outfit Wedbush upgrades Wingstop (NASDAQ:WING) from Neutral to Outperform.
    • The firm lowers the price target from $71 to $69, a 14% upside to yesterday's close.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • WING has 6 Buy-equivalent analyst ratings, 8 Holds, and 1 Sell with an average price target of $69.92.
    • WING shares are up 1.9% premarket to $61.73.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM
  • ABIL

    Ability’s line of credit to be repaid and converted into equity, Shares up 43%

    • Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) entered into an agreement to repay NIS 5.5M or ~$1.5M line of credit with an Israeli commercial bank using funds from Messrs. Hurgin and Aurovsky.
    • Further, the company will issue 226,426 ordinary shares and 226,426 warrants at a conversion price of $3.25 to each of Messrs. Hurgin and Aurovsky in a private placement.
    • Closing is expected to take place on or around January 3, 2019.
    • ABIL +43.5% premarket to $2.54
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean +2.5% after $830M drilling contract from Chevron

    • Transocean (NYSE:RIG) rises 2.5% in premarket trading after announcing a rig design and construction management contract as well as a five-year drilling contract with Chevron (NYSE:CVX) USA for one of its two ultra-deepwater drillships under construction in Singapore.
    • The drilling contract has an estimated backlog of $8320M, excluding mobilization and reimbursables.
    • The rig will be the first ultra-deepwater floater rated for 20,000 psi operations; it's expected to start operations in the Gulf of Mexico in H2 2021.
    • In the event of termination for convenience by the customer, Transocean will be compensated for its incremental 20,000 psi subsea investment in the rig. Additionally, a termination for convenience occurring after April 2020, would result in a substantial termination fee.
    • Previously: Transocean adds to fleet with Ocean Rig closing (Dec. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM | 42 Comments
  • APHA

    Aphria says Green Growth's proposal undervalues its shares

    • "Aphria (NYSE:APHA) shareholders should be aware that the value of GGB's per-share offer is based on a hypothetical valuation of its own shares, with no relation to the current price," Aphria says in a statement responding to Green Growth's (OTCQB:GGBXF) proposal to buy Aphria in an all-stock transaction.
    • Aphria +18% in premarket trading.
    • The statement adds, "The board believes that GGB is attempting to acquire the company through a highly conditional offer at a significant discount to its current and future value."
    • Aphria's board has established an independent committee of directors to consider the GGB proposal and any formal offer received.
    • Previously: Green Growth considers Aphria bid (update) (Dec. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 AM | 29 Comments

  • Futures gain as recovery continues

    • It's a roller coaster ride on Wall Street heading into the penultimate trading day of the year.
    • U.S. stocks roared back to end in positive territory on Thursday after suffering steep losses for much of the session, and the same sentiment took place overnight, with futures now pointing to gains, up 0.4%.
    • "The market is right now in a psychological frenzy," said David Katz, CIO at Matrix Asset Advisors. "There's fear of the market going down; there's fear of missing the rebound."
    • Oil is up 2.4% at $45.70/bbl, gold is 0.1% lower at $1280/ounce and the 10-year Treasury yield is flat at 2.75%.
    • ETFs: SPY, QQQ, DIA, SH, SSO, VOO, SDS, IVV, SPXU, TQQQ, UPRO, PSQ, SPXL, RSP, SPXS, SQQQ, QID, DOG, QLD, DXD, UDOW, SDOW, VFINX, EPS, DDM, QQEW, QQQE, SPLX, SFLA, QQXT, SPUU, SPXE, UDPIX, OTPIX, RYARX, SPXN, SPDN, SPXT, SPXV
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 AM | 24 Comments
